result.execSummary:
All charges against Nicole R Thompson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicole R Thompson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Order to Dismiss.
Based upon the State's Motion to Dismiss, the above case is hereby dismissed without prejudice.

11:03 AM case called and held via Zoom. Defendant Nicole R Thompson appeared by video.  Attorney William A. Schembera appeared by video for Nicole R Thompson.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. The State moves to dismiss the case- So ordered.

Final Pre-Trial Conference: September 13, 2022 at 11:00 AM (all motions in limine, jury instructions, witness lists, etc to be filed by this date) Hearing to be held via Zoom.

(Case called at 9:35 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Nicole R Thompson appeared by video.  Attorney William A. Schembera in court for Nicole R Thompson. Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense enters Not Guilty pleas on all counts and requests the case be schedule for Jury Trial. Court receives Not Guilty pleas. 
Further scheduling with Branch 5 Judicial Assistant.
